4373.verse: وَمَا|And not|72|83|46$نُرِيهِم|We showed them|134|156|15520$مِّنْ|of|50|72|53$ءَايَةٍ|a Sign|61|83|998$إِلَّا|but|42|64|86$هِىَ|it|53|75|665$أَكْبَرُ|(was) greater|111|133|1897$مِنْ|than|50|61|53$أُخْتِهَا‌ۖ|its sister,|82|115|15521$وَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم|and We seized them|154|220|15522$بِٱلْعَذَابِ|with the punishment|155|221|12135$لَعَلَّهُمْ|so that they may|135|168|1621$يَرْجِعُونَ|return.|105|105|3002$

4374.verse: وَقَالُواْ|And they said,|116|128|760$يَـٰٓأَيُّهَ|`O|62|87|15523$ٱلسَّاحِرُ|[the] magician!|121|146|11512$ٱدْعُ|Invoke|64|89|663$لَنَا|for us|58|83|338$رَبَّكَ|your Lord|82|107|586$بِمَا|by what|74|86|43$عَهِدَ|He has made covenant|172|197|3563$عِندَكَ|with you.|82|132|6754$إِنَّنَا|Indeed, we|94|144|2688$لَمُهْتَدُونَ|(will) surely be guided.`|178|203|683$

4379.verse: فَٱسْتَخَفَّ|So he bluffed|108|119|15531$قَوْمَهُۥ|his people,|91|113|6886$فَأَطَاعُوهُ‌ۚ|and they obeyed him.|164|186|15532$إِنَّهُمْ|Indeed, they|105|127|106$كَانُواْ|were|69|91|94$قَوْمًا|a people|76|87|3073$فَـٰسِقِينَ|defiantly disobedient.|162|162|7658$

4380.verse: فَلَمَّآ|So when|77|90|141$ءَاسَفُونَا|they angered Us,|134|160|15533$ٱنتَقَمْنَا|We took retribution|148|174|15534$مِنْهُمْ|from them,|92|118|730$فَأَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ|and We drowned them|169|182|6764$أَجْمَعِينَ|all.|95|95|1408$

4384.verse: إِنْ|Not|44|50|225$هُوَ|he|48|60|298$إِلَّا|(was) except|108|120|86$عَبْدٌ|a slave,|72|84|15541$أَنْعَمْنَا|We bestowed Our favor|177|190|10509$عَلَيْهِ|on him|64|76|395$وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ|and We made him|137|143|10213$مَثَلاً|an example|94|286|261$لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٲٓءِيلَ|for (the) Children of Israel.|198|390|3092$

4373.verse: And We showed them not a sign except that it was greater than its sister, and We seized them with affliction that perhaps they might return [to faith].

4374.verse: And they said [to Moses], "O magician, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. Indeed, we will be guided."

4375.verse: But when We removed from them the affliction, at once they broke their word.

4376.verse: And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?

4377.verse: Or am I [not] better than this one who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?

4378.verse: Then why have there not been placed upon him bracelets of gold or come with him the angels in conjunction?"

4379.verse: So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of Allah].

4380.verse: And when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all.

4381.verse: And We made them a precedent and an example for the later peoples.

4382.verse: And when the son of Mary was presented as an example, immediately your people laughed aloud.

4383.verse: And they said, "Are your gods better, or is he?" They did not present the comparison except for [mere] argument. But, [in fact], they are a people prone to dispute.

4384.verse: Jesus was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.

4385.verse: And if We willed, We could have made [instead] of you angels succeeding [one another] on the earth.
